subhead: At least 27 people have lost their lives since the start of the year while attempting to reach England, while more than 33,000 have succeeded. Residents who find indifference intolerable feel compelled to help.

Primatologist and ethologist Jane Goodall has died at age 91
subhead: The work carried out in Tanzania by the British researcher revolutionized the way we look at chimpanzees, and consequently, at humans. A pioneer of modern ethology, she became an ambassador for the protection of wildlife. She died on October 1 in Los Angeles at the age of 91.

title: PSG win 2-1 at Barcelona in Champions League
subhead: Barcelona and PSG have not been on the best of terms over the past decade, with the Catalans recording one of the greatest comebacks in the history of the game in 2017 with a 6-1 win over the Parisians. On Wednesday, however, PSG's Gonçalo Ramos scored a last-minute goal to clinch the victory at Olympic Stadium in Barcelona.

title: Reducing speed limit to 50 km/h on Paris' ring road has reportedly led to less traffic, pollution and noise
subhead: One year ago, the maximum speed limit on Paris' ring road was lowered from 80 to 50 kilometers per hour. Two preliminary studies have reported positive indicators, though they stop short of reaching a definitive conclusion.

title: In Finnish Lapland, tourism is encroaching on the last remaining sanctuaries
subhead: The 'Green to Grey' investigation reveals the consequences of the tourism boom in Finnish Lapland. Popular with French tourists, this region is one of the last remaining areas of unspoiled nature in Europe.

subhead: Two investigations launched in France shed light on a disturbing phenomenon originating in the United States: digital spaces where young boys engage in horribly deviant behavior.

title: In Greece, an abbot is arrested for trafficking religious artifacts
subhead: Affiliated with the monastery of Kalavryta, in the Peloponnese, the clergyman was caught as he attempted to sell 14 Byzantine icons and two 18th-century Gospels for the sum of €200,000.

title: War in Ukraine: The daily lives of Kherson residents who live underground, threatened by Russian drones
subhead: Photographer Virginie Nguyen Hoang captured the daily lives of Kherson residents for Le Monde, as they live under the constant threat of a 'human safari' − a manhunt carried out by Russian drones. With no way to leave the city, they survive in makeshift underground shelters.
byline: Thomas d’Istria and  Virginie NGuyen Hoang
